intro: Trichomanes pannosum, commonly known as the broad-leaved holly fern, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, epiphytic fern that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has delicate, elongated fronds with a dense covering of tiny, scale-like structures. Its reproductive structures, known as sorus, are located on the underside of the fronds. Trichomanes pannosum is characterized by its intricate leaf patterns and is often found growing on trees or rocks in humid habitats.
